intro: Pseudocaryophyllus jaccoudii, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has hairy, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves that are adapted to conserve water. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Pseudocaryophyllus jaccoudii is often found in sandy soils and is well-suited to survive in harsh, dry environments.
